newsitem.title: UK: NWE naphtha steady to stronger in quiet market.
newsitem.headline: NWE naphtha steady to stronger in quiet market.

text.p: NWE naphtha was steady on the physical front but slightly higher on the swaps front on Wednesday in a quiet market, traders said.
On the physical front, traders assessed full range cargoes at around $185/$190cif NWE.
Paper, however, edged higher with April quoted at $196.50/$197 cif NWE, while May stood at $197.00/$197.50.
Some traders speculated that a couple of players might be considering putting a squeeze on the market in May, but others dismissed such a move.
The market continued to monitor the amount of material leaving the area for Asia, but said the effect of tight supply would be muted buyers remained out of the market.
"If prices get to high, petchems will simply turn to other feedstock such as butane and propane. I think a few players are already doing that," traders said. -- London Newsroom, +44 171 542 7714.
